thread.title: Princess Diana's dresses are heading to an exhibit in Kensington Palace
thread.title_full: Princess Diana's dresses are heading to an exhibit in Kensington Palace

author: USA TODAY
title: Princess Diana's dresses are heading to an exhibit in Kensington Palace
text:
Princess Diana's dresses are heading to an exhibit in Kensington Palace Maria Puente , USA TODAY Published 5:38 p.m. ET Nov. 15, 2016 | Updated 14 minutes ago 46 Shares Share Princess Diana's fashion will be showcased in an exhibit at Kensington Palace. USA TODAY 
From romantic and girlishly demure to knock-out, drop-dead glamour, the late Princess Diana's journey from naive teen to global fashion goddess will be on display at Kensington Palace next year, nearly 20 years after her shocking death. 
Diana: Her Fashion Story will open Feb. 24 at the palace, the former home of the late Princess of Wales and the current home of both her sons, Prince William and Prince Harry, and her two grandchildren, Prince George and Princess Charlotte of Cambridge. 
The exhibit, the first Diana-focused show at the palace in 10 years, will trace the evolution of Diana's look and explore how she learned to use her image and her fashion to help showcase the causes she cared about, according to Historic Royal Palaces, the charity that operates royal palaces and estates that also are open to the public as museums. 
Princess Diana's blue velvet gown by Victor Edelstein she wore to dance with John Travolta at the White House in 1985. (Photo: Historic Royal Palaces, SWNS) 
The exhibit will explore "the story of a young woman who had to quickly learn the rules of royal and diplomatic dressing, who in the process put the spotlight on the British fashion industry and designers," says Eleri Lynn, curator of the show. "We see her growing in confidence throughout her life, increasingly taking control of how she was represented, and intelligently communicating through her clothes. This is a story many women around the world can relate to." 
The exhibit will also feature a temporary White Garden, dedicated to her life, image and style, in the palace's historic Sunken Garden, which will be planted with such flowers and foliage as tulips and scented narcisii , a carpet of forget-me-nots and pots of classic English white roses. 
The pale pink Emanuel blouse rPrincess Diana wore for her engagement portrait by Lord Snowdon in 1981. (Photo: Historic Royal Palaces, SWNS) 
But the main event will be the celebrated outfits from throughout Diana's short public life, from 1981 until she was killed in a Paris car crash on Aug. 31, 1997, at age 36. From glamorous gowns worn in the 1980s after her 1981 marriage to Prince Charles, to the chic Catherine Walker suits she wore on engagements in the 1990s, the exhibit will explore Diana's relationships with her favorite designers through some of their original fashion sketches created for her during the design process. 
Familiar highlights will include the pale pink Emanuel blouse worn for Diana’s engagement portrait by Lord Snowdon in 1981; and Victor Edelstein’s inky blue velvet gown that she wore to dance with John Travolta at the White House in 1985. 
Conservator with Princess Diana's blue tartan plaid jacket by Emanuel that she wore on a visit to Venice in 1985. It was recently re-discovered and purchased at auction by Historic Royal Palaces. (Photo: Historic Royal Palaces, SWNS) 
Some outfits are going on public display for the first time, such as a blue tartan Emanuel suit (David and Elizabeth Emanuel also designed her memorably pouf-y wedding gown) that she wore on an official visit to Venice in the 1980s. The suit, a rare survival of Diana's day-wear, was only recently rediscovered and acquired by Historic Royal Palaces at auction. 
Diana's clothes and artifacts have been traded at auction for years; just weeks before her death, she auctioned off some of her outfits in New York to raise more than $3 million for charity, at the suggestion of Prince William. 
The Travolta gown has been bought and sold multiple times; among the most recent was an auction in London in 2013 when it sold for more than $360,000 to an anonymous British man who wanted it to cheer up his wife. Facebook   A Versace ice blue silk gown with beading, centre, worn by Diana, Princess of Wales in 1991 for a Bazaar magazine shoot with photographer Partick Demarchelier, is on display during a media preview of an exhibition of 25 dresses and outfits worn by Diana entitled 'Diana: Her Fashion Story' at Kensington Palace in London. Alastair Grant, AP A detail shows the beadwork of the 1991 Atelier Versace silk gown worn by Princess Diana for a Harper's Bazaar photoshoot with Patrick Demarchelier. Jack Taylor Fullscreen A strapless, white silk crepe dress and jacket, embroidered with sequins and pearls, designed by Catherine Walker in 1989 and known as the 'Elvis dress' was worn by the late Diana, Princess of Wales, is on display during a press preview of 'Diana: Her Fashion Story.' Will Oliver, EPA Princess Diana arrives, May 15, 1987, at the Cannes Film Festival. The Princess is wearing a pale blue silk chiffon strapless dress with a matching chiffon stole designed by fashion designer Catherine Walker. Tim Graham, AP Fullscreen Princess Diana's 1987 Catherine Walker blue silk chiffon evening gown, center, is displayed at Kensington Palace. The exhibition 'Diana: Her Fashion Story', which showcases a number of the Princess' dresses and outfits, opens to the public on Feb, 24, as part of events commemorating the life of Princess Diana to mark the 20th anniversary of her death in Paris on Aug. 31, 1997. Jack Taylor, Getty Images Fullscreen A photograph by Mario Testino of Diana, Princess of Wales is framed by two dress that appear in 'Diana: Her Fashion Story.' The exhibit follows her evolution from the demure outfits of her first public appearances to the glamorous gowns of her later life and is being hosted in Kensington Palace, her London residence. Alastair Grant, AP A member of staff poses beside a 1992 Catherine Walker grey silk satin dress with simulated pearl embroidery on the bodice worn by Princess Diana for a photo shoot with Mario Testino for Vanity Fair. Jack Taylor, Getty Images A staffer touches the bodice of the 1990 Catherine Walker grey silk satin dress with simulated pearl embroidery during a preview for the forthcoming 'Diana: Her Fashion Story' exhibition. Carl Court A 1992 Catherine Walker green silk velvet evening dress with velvet and diamante buttons, center, worn for Diana's Vanity Fair photo shoot with Mario Testino in 1997 is on display in the 'Diana: Her Fashion Story' exhibition. Carl Court, Getty Images A dress by designer Catherine Walker, and worn by Britain's Diana, Princess of Wales during an official visit to Austria in 1986, is part of the 'Diana: Her Fashion Story' exhibition. Daniel Leal-Olivias, AFP/Getty Images Fullscreen A selection of coats and outfits worn by Diana, Princess of Wales, including at right, a brown tweed wool day suit by Bill Pashley, which she wore on her honeymoon in Scotland 1981, are part of the exhibition of 25 dresses and outfits entitled 'Diana: Her Fashion Story.' Alastair Grant, AP A dress by designer Catherine Walker, and worn by Britain's Diana, Princess of Wales during an official portrait with her husband Charles, Prince of Wales in 1987, can be seen in the 'Diana: Her Fashion Story' exhibition. Daniel Leal-Olivas, AFP/Getty Images Diana, Princess of Wales wore this evening dress by Catherine Walker of white silk crepe embroidered with sequins on an official visit to South Africa in 1986. Alastair Grant, AP This 1979 Regamus dress (C) worn by Princess Diana at the 1979 Ball at Althorp House is part of the 'Diana: Her Fashion Story,'showcase. Jack Taylor, Getty Images Fullscreen Bruce Oldfield's cream satin dress worn by Princess Diana during a visit to the Courtauld Institute of Art in 1990 and a State Banquet at Buckingham Palace in 1991, takes front and center, next to a 1987 Catherine Walker pink satin evening gown, right worn by the princess. Jack Taylor, Getty Images Diana, Princess of Wales walks past the press in London. This outfit is featured in an exhibition of 25 dresses and outfits worn by Diana entitled 'Diana: Her Fashion Story.' at Kensington Palace in London, opening on Feb. 24, 2017. Adrian Dennis, AP Catherine Walker's 1996 red day suit worn was by Princess Diana at the launch of the HIV / Aids charity London Lighthouse. Jack Taylor, Getty Images Fullscreen Lady Diana Spencer was still a teen when her engagement to Prince Charles was announced, and her clothes reflected her youth at the time. The pale pink Emanuel blouse worn for her engagement portrait by Lord Snowdon in 1981 also will be in the exhibit. Royal Historic Palaces, SWNS.com A closeup of the Emanuel blouse with its pink bow at the neck. Historic Royal Palaces, SWNS.com A blue tartan jacket by Emanuel, worn by Princess Diana on a visit to Venice in 1985, will be one of the outfits seen in 'Diana: Her Fashion Story' opening at Kensington Palace in February 2017. HIstoric Royal Palaces, SWNS.com Victor Edelstein’s inky blue velvet gown that Diana wore to dance with John Travolta at the White House in 1985. It will be seen in 'Diana: Her Fashion Story' in 2017. Historic Royal Palaces, SWNS.com Diana in the Edelstein velvet gown on the dance floor with John Travolta as President Reagan and wife Nancy look on at the White House in 1985. Anwar Hussein, WireImage The blue tartan Emanuel suit is a rare survival of Diana's day-wear; it was only recently rediscovered and acquired by Historic Royal Palaces at auction. Historic Royal Palaces, SWNS.com A conservator works on the Edelstein gown in a closeup of the bodice. Historic Royal Palaces, SWNS.com Fullscreen The Diana exhibit will explore her fashion evolution from demure teen to glamour goddess by the end of her life. But she gave hints of her fashion sense even before her 1981 marriage. In one of her first public appearances post-engagement, she went to an event in London with Princess Grace of Monaco, in March 1981. Her décolletage prompted headlines such as "Di Takes the Plunge." Associated Press Princess Diana, in full glamour mode about two years before her death, arrives at a celebrity gala in London on Nov.20, 1995. This was just hours before Diana's infamous taped television interview with the BBC was broadcast. DAVID CHESKIN, Associated Press One of her most memorable dresses was her cream-puff of a wedding gown, by David and Elizabeth Emanuel, seen here after her wedding to Prince Charles in London, on July 29, 1981. AP A television reporter gestures during the press preview, as she stands next the dress, known as the "Elvis Dress" by designer Catherine Walker, and worn by Britain's Diana, Princess of Wales in Hong Kong in 1989. Daniel Leal-Olivas, AFP/Getty Images The jacket of the "Elvis Dress",by designer Catherine Walker, shows the pearl detailing. Daniel Leal-Olivas, AFP/Getty Images A dress by designer Catherine Walker, and worn by Britain's Diana, Princess of Wales at an engagement in Leicester Square, London can be seen in the exhibit. Daniel Leal-Olivas, AFP/Getty Images A member of staff poses with a dress designed by Catherine Walker in 1997 during a preview for the 'Diana: Her Fashion Story' exhibition. Carl Court, Getty Images Catherine Walker's 1997 pale pink day suit worn by Princess Diana at the Savoy Hotel in London in 1997 can also be seen in the exhibit. Jack Taylor, Getty Images Like this topic? You may also like these photo galleries: Replay
